Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JF_de_Montreal
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto on business for 4 days and stayed 3 nights here. I'd booked my trip -- flight + hotel -- on Expedia. On the morning following my 1st night there, I sent for breakfast and was surprised to be told that the rate I got did not include breakfast. I had a very light meal and the waiter said he wouldn't charge me for the whole buffet but rather à la carte de couple of toasts I had. Nevertheless, it doesn't change the fact that I find it somewhat "cheap" that any luxury hotel would charge you over and above for every little thing, from Internet access to in-room coffee to breakfast. (To be clear, this hotel charged for none of this -- except, in my case, breakfast -- and had bottles of water and green apples available at every floor.) So I tweeted this before going out. When I got back to my room, I found a very personalized letter **en français!** from the hotel manager, thanking me (!) for posting a comment on Twitter. The letter explained that the hotel currently ran two rates -- that is, with and without breakfast -- and that Expedia rates were of the latter type. The letter mentioned that soon, all rates would include breakfast. But the letter also included information about a deal this chain has in place with my organization (which means they actually did some background research on me!) and concluded with a pledge to offer me free breakfast for the remainder of my stay. Wow. Some would call this customer empowerment, or a good exemple of service failure recovery (and the paradox that comes with it). I just call it outstanding service. This hotel may be as clean, well-located, and nicely decorated, these are all basic factors to me. What will keep me going back to it from now on is its human, personal touch. Merci for a great stay! Jean-François Ouellet

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: IanoftheGulf
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Very stylish rooms in which a lot of attention to detail has been placed. The room amenities, including the bathroom with large shower room is excellent. My only issue was the temperature control. I just couldnt get the heating down from 23.5c which made for a restless sleep. The front desk staff's attention to issues was also evident. I had an issue with my corporate credit card, the card seemed to have lost its readibility, and had to use my personal card. Later, after I had checked in, the manager heard about this from her front desk and she personally called Amex to verify my card and manually put the charge on the corporate card. A nice touch. Will definitely stay there again on next month's visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyle C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent design elements in hotel, rooms are spacious and well thought out, attention to detail. Meeting rooms well setup. Had several meals at hotel, food was generally quite good, one meal poor quality. Excellent starting place to visit Toronto downtown with family.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect one night escape”
Reviews.Author: j v
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a one night getaway in our own city and chose the Le Germaine – Maple Leaf Square as they had a package that had everything we wanted. (Night In Package) Sharon, the concierge, contacted me a few days before our check in to ensure that all the details were taken care of, (including a personalized note to be left for my husband), and from the moment we arrived, everything was taken care of beautifully. The room was lovely, the room service excellent (dinner and breakfast), and the service was outstanding. In all, it was the perfect break from our everyday and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...especially for an event at the ACC”
Reviews.Author: Tobie
Reviews.Content: From the initial phone contact, to booking a Sports package for a Leafs game online, to check out after our stay, our experience with Le Germain MLS was top notch. We had a standard room that was furnished with a comfortable king bed, luxury linens and had a fairly spacious set up. The Molton Brown toiletries and espresso machine are a nice touch. The package came with free breakfast and valet parking which, on an event night was much appreciated. Granted breakfast is a small selection of fruits, pastries, cereal and juice, but it was kept spotlessly clean and we felt the offerings were fine----with a lovely selection of teas for those of us who aren't coffee drinkers. The area is a light filled space on the second floor. Before the game we had dinner at e11even the restaurant on site and all 4 of us really enjoyed the upbeat ambiance, the food and service. This was our second time at the restaurant and we still give it high marks. The skywalk to the ACC from the Maple Leaf complex was much appreciated on a rainy evening, and if there are no events, it's also a direct way to access the Path from the hotel. With key scans in the elevator, you can feel secure in the fact that people who aren't guests in the hotel cannot access guest areas---even during the day. From the first contact by phone to our check out, we received nothing but warm, friendly, efficient and professional service. Especially if this is your first impression of Toronto, it doesn't get any better!

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: RGT6416
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Le Germain Maple Leaf Square, but it certainly will not be my last. From the very beginning everything was perfect. The young man at the desk was very friendly and called me by name throughout the process. I had book a deluxe room and asked if there might be a chance for an upgrade. After checking he indicated he could move me from my 600+ sq. ft. room to an executive suite at over 900 sq. ft. for an additional $50 per night. It proved to be money well spent. As a bonus at checkout, they reduced the upgrade charge to $25 per night without any request from me. The room, while very modern, was very comfortable and well organized. The bath was terrific with great lighting, something often missing today. Breakfast, which was included in the rate was fine, although nothing special, with assorted cold meats, bread items, and many fruits and cereals. I did not eat in the hotel restaurants, but the bar area seemed to busy all hours of the day and evening. The best part, by far, was the attitude and helpfulness of the entire staff. Everyone smiled, often greeting me by name. The concierge--I wish I knew her name, was one of the very best with restaurant suggestions and helpful hints about going to the Hockey Hall of Fame. Try this hotel and you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, not the best location (even if you're there for the hockey game)”
Reviews.Author: prof_trad
Reviews.Content: It will be interesting to see if Le Germain will be able to maintain its standards with this property, given its location. Nice touches: 1) sublime mattress, linen, pillows; 2) awesome breakfast (yeah for Montreal bagels!!!); 3) great second floor - well designed space with fine expresso/cappucino machine; 4) Molton Brown toiletries; 5) nice rainfall shower; and 6) his-hers closets in the bathroom area. On my "so-so" list: 1) nice room but could be slightly more spacious; 2) functional, small fitness room; and 3) ear-plugs (don't go there for a restful stay). And on the "what were they thinking?!" list: 1) cramped reception desk/area - not a good first impression; 2) the huge artwork over the bed (hubby felt threatened by so much testosterone); and 3) just "ok" service (where is the "boutique" feel in all this?).

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: ENELRAD_MN
Reviews.Content: I planed an evening for my sister in Toronto from overseas. They assisted in all planning aspects from the car and driver to the restaurant and every little alternative request made in between. Wonderful service and an exceptional experience for both myself and my sister.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: raylee11
Reviews.Content: Excellent overall! Friendly and accommodating staff. Fantastic location downtown...stumbling distance to ACC for game and easy walk to restaurants and Union Station. There is the PATH which is a walking path all indoors....important when it's cold outside. Room clean, spacious and great view of CN Tower. What more can you ask for? Complimentary wifi, coffee/tea, etc. Bed amazingly comfortable. Rainfall shower was kinda weird but got used to it. Only beef was valet parking for $38, but what else can you do right downtown. Just a personal pet peeve. Highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very swish and very good”
Reviews.Author: *Mark*J*L*
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Le Germain property I have stayed at and I'm really liking the brand. This time it was the very new, large hotel in Maple Leaf Square. It's ideally located for the financial district and the PATH (Toronto's underground street system) starts just across the street. I got a deal including a free upgrade to a suite which was pretty spectacular - huge, well appointed rooms, 2 giant TVs, great bathroom and a walk-in closet. The service was up to the usual excellent standard and I thought overall value for money was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Style, location, and a fair price.”
Reviews.Author: William C
Reviews.Content: Took the wife here as a treat after being away on business and could not have been happier. The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. Our room was only a basic room and it was spectacular, very modern/trendy, and if I were to sum up in one of word, I'd just say "comfortable". I travel a lot for work and this was better than what I've seen in London and San Francisco and at a much better price. It is walking distance to Union Station so convenient to get anywhere in the city. Tips - I found a deal on expedia (travelocity has it as well) for free valet parking and it seems to come up fairly often so keep an eye out for it. - There is a cafe area on the second floor but it was nothing special, hit the starbucks across the street instead. - I've not been but I hear good things about Eleven restaurant next door and Real Sports is right there too (I've reviewed that restaurant, it's amazing. )

Reviews.Title: “in the midst of the city but still secluded.”
Reviews.Author: PKtourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a luxury room with only a view of the office workers in the building next door - try and get a view if you can. Modern hotel, nice big rooms, spa like bathroom, well appointed. Nespresso machines in the room. Service was discreet and professional but based on other reviews I had higher expectations. Hotel was very quiet and peaceful, being in the secluded square helps, but wonder how noisy it is when there is an event at the ACC nest door. Good location. Good quality breakfast buffet, although there did seem to be a lack of staff attending to show you were things were. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly cool”
Reviews.Author: allblacks99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor. Central location in Toronto near the CN tower. The staff were low key and friendly. The hotel was quiet and the furnishings and rooms were ultra-cool. Great bed. Great room service wine list. I would go back to Toronto just to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Igor S
Reviews.Content: My first visit to the Le Germain hotel was as good as expected. Hotel has great location, modern design and outstanding service. Our room was perfectly clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond perfection”
Reviews.Author: HabsfanJez
Reviews.Content: Gave it a shot last December for the first time,being from Montreal,I knew about this great chain and was looking forward to it.They did not disappoint...From my first call to make a reservation ,passing by when I got there,until when I checked-out,everything was a breeze.I experienced an in-room massage,with the therapist Naomi.She was very experienced,knew exactly where and how I need pressure,I recommend her in a heart beat! Since I have been going back and forth from Montreal to Toronto,I was aware of not being able to watch the Habs on tv unless they Play the Leafs.Le Germain staff sent me their guy who in charge for technical support and found a way to plug my laptop to the tv so I can watch it on their big flat screen instead of my laptop!!!What a service ! Everything in the room is thought about.First of,the unit was very spacious,lots of light coming from the window .Long desk overlooking the window .For the coffee lovers they have an espresso machine in the room with different favors offered.I could go on and on,I know I am forgetting things but most importantly,they won a new and loyal costumer in me!Thanks again for the top noch service! Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: HoneyGirl88
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend was in Toronto for business, so I joined him for 4 nights in late November. Great location - within walking distance to CN Tower and access to the subway right across the street. Clean modern decor and wonderful service - the female concierge (sorry, can't remember her name!) was particularly fabulous and super helpful! Had a pricey ($25) but very delicious turkey burger in the bar/lounge, and I loved the breakfast buffet - sliced meats, cheeses, gravlax, yogurt, granola, pastries, hard boiled eggs, porridge, fruit, roasted potatoes, mini quiches...all delicious and in a beautiful light-filled lounge area! Fabulous quality coffee/tea machine too. The free hotel wifi and computer in the lounge were also very handy. Rooms were contemporary and uber comfy - the beds are like heaven and are so hard to leave (so much so that we are actually very tempted to order the mattress from the hotel website!). Negatives: the gym is very small and sad and totally uninspiring. And for those of you who have thin eyelids like me, the room does not get totally dark - the blackout blinds do not entirely cover the edges of the windows so you see the bright digital displays from Air Canada Centre. There's also annoying blinking lights from the in-room coffee machine. However, I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel DESERVES the number 1 spot on TA! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Superjungleboy
Reviews.Content: This is officially my favourite hotel! In the heart of everything. The rooms are just amazing, I have a hard time leaving in the morning to head for work on Bay. The Front desk staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel has a large well appointed gym. Amazing rainfall shower and bedside lighting controls. I'll stay here any chance I get!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Esse10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in Canada for a wedding. The hotel is smart, beautifully decorated and the service is exceptional. The staff were unfailingly polite helpful and seemed genuinely interested and friendly. Rooms were spacious and attractive. Wonderful big showers and bathroom. The location is central. Beneath the hotel is a huge supermarket where one can buy food to bring into the hotel. Unusually the hotel actually brings this to your attention! The bride and groom actually stayed one night (prior to the wedding) at very late notice and the staff prepared a little welcoming treat for them in their room. We enjoyed it so much we stayed a further night before leaving Canada and found exactly the same hospitable treatment. Lounge with tea and coffee available free all day. Small but decent gym.

Reviews.Title: “Service and comfort, second to none....”
Reviews.Author: Ben O
Reviews.Content: Hello all, I just had to do a little write up about the Hotel Le Germain located in Toronto beside the Air Canada Centre where the Toronto Maple Leafs Play. The rooms have a modern feel and very comfortable. I did not want to get out of the bed I slept in, in fact I actually pulled the sheets to look of the brand of mattress so that I could order one! But to my dismay it's their own brand. The shower is located in the middle of the room, using wooden blinds to cover the glass for privacy. Ultra modern vanity look as well and private toilet area. The view I had was of the CN tower. At night the view it colourful with the CN tower glowing and the lights from the buildings in the surrounding area, not to mention the crowds of people walking to and from the arena. Did I mention that the access to the arena is actually inside? You do not have to worry about any coats or warm clothing, just what ever you would wear to go out in. The rest of the room is layered with modern touches, such as lighting, entertainment and artwork. Unless you have updated your own home to this style, you will feel a sense of extra comfort in sense. The service from the front desk is second to none, anything I asked for or needed was met with total satisfaction and came with a warm feel, I mean it did not feel rehearsed. I used Valet parking, it was very easy and very quick, I felt totally comfortable in handing my keys the gentleman. I would like to thank the concierge Evan for your service and to the hotel itself. It's definitely a five star hotel. Thank you Ben Oke

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel with Top Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Samuel K
Reviews.Content: "Location, Location Location." Thats what you look for in real estate. And that was the primary reason I chose to stay with "Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square". Had a friend visit from NY for a couple of days. Personally I live in Markham. However, all our planned sights were in the Downtown area (not to mention front row tickets to a Leafs game at the Air Canada Centre). So why not stay at DT hotel instead of driving down everyday?? Did my homework, and found the ACC, CN tower (360 restaurant), Nathan Philips Square to be on the doorsteps of "Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square". Clubs, Entertainment District and the ScotiaBank Theatre were all accessible with $10 taxi rides. Sure I could had stayed with the Royal York, but I personally prefer a hotel with a modern decor. Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square equal sharp and crisp! Make sure you book the Maple Leaf Square location not the one on Mercer Street. I must commend their concierge, Gregory! He went above and beyond. Literally planned our whole trip from beginning to end. Presented us with the history of Toronto. Recommended sights to see. Made all our lunch & dinner reservations. Make sure you ask for him! We stayed with the hotel in December, our exploits included: front row tickets to Leafs game, skating at Nathan Philips Square under Christmas lights, Niagara Falls at dusk, dinner at 360 & Ki Modern Japanese + Bar & Sheraton Hotel over looking Niagara Falls. Regarding the hotel. Slight problem with the wireless internet in our room. Thankfully, the front desk address the issue promptly and professionally. Loved their breakfast, it's not your typical continental breakfast. You will be pleasantly surprised. All their staff are courteous and professional! I look forward to staying with them again!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in TO”
Reviews.Author: gmd75
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing negative to say about this place. We stayed New Year's Eve. This is a new and modern hotel that did pretty much everything right. Very close (walking) to Union station. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, very nice...”
Reviews.Author: scud24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days of 'touristing' just before Christmas, having chosen it for its Trip Advisor 'No. 1 hotel in Toronto' status... You're a discerning bunch out there in TA land..! For tourists coming from Europe, it's an excellent choice. We arrived at Pearson Airport and jumped on the Airport Express coach, which stops outside the Fairmont Hotel, which is about 200 yards away from the Le Germain. The hotel is right next to the Air Canada Centre, where the Toronto ice hockey and basketball teams play, and also 50 yards from Union Station, from where you can get to everywhere... It is also only a short walk to the Lake front and the ferry over to the Toronto islands, to the CN Tower and to the Steam Whistle micro brewery, which has a splendid tour, accompanied by its product...:)) We had a standard room with a view of the CN Tower, which was very clean, comfortable and well laid out with all the amenities you would expect and a splendid walk-in shower with a 'rainfall' shower head, which led to some rather over-long showering! An additional facility is the complimentary coffee and tea station on the second floor, which is availble 24 hours a day to guests. As we were being tourists, some local knowledge was very helpful and the concierge team at the Le Germain are brilliant. Susan sorted out our day trip to the Niagara Falls, which was great fun, and was a mine of information on all the other daft questions we asked her. If we ever return to Toronto, there is no doubt that this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “December get-away”
Reviews.Author: pickering4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Germain is a beautiful hotel and the service is wonderful. Staff are friendly and helpful. Although we did not get a "welcome amenity" with our VIP code, we did get a wonderful upgrade to a one bedroom suite with a wrap around balcony (too bad it was so cold that day). The continental breakfast that was included in the price of the room was well appointed. Lots of cheese, smoked salmon, breads, pastries and great coffee. Parking is a bit of a rip ($35.00), but there is a parking garage across the Square that I believe is only $18 per day. Would totally go back here (although I am afraid I would be disappointed in a regular room after experiencing the amazing Suite we had)!

Reviews.Title: “Started out well but left very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: EHWToronto
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here for our wedding anniversary based on the Trip Advisor reviews. It started out very well however we left feeling very disappointed. Here is what we liked and what we didn't like: 1. When we arrived there was a very nice cheese sampler waiting for us in our room. 2. The room and bathroom were very clean and modern. 3. The desserts from room service were fantastic Why we were disappointed: 1. When we checked out there was a bar charge added to our bill. We never went to the bar during our stay. When I asked how this happened I was told that someone may have accidentally used our room number on the bill. The charge was reversed however they need to have a better system in place that even requires a signature or a card swipe. It's unsettling to think a charge could be added just by saying any room number. 2. There were two pillows that we slept on top of the king size bed. The next morning when my wife woke up and turned the second pillow around (the one underneath), she noticed there was a large dry blood stain on the pillow. This was not from her as the colour was a light brown. You could tell it had been washed several times as it hadn't fully been removed. At first we were going to take the pillow down to the front desk but decided to call the manager up to our room and speak to her in private so as not to make a scene. When she came up we showed her and told her how this should not have even been used by the housekeeping staff and put on the pillow. It's not like it was a small stain, it was very large and obvious. It was disturbing to think that someone from the staff would even put this pillow case on. Needless to say it left a very sickening feeling in our stomach to know that was there the entire night. The manager apologized and agreed that this had been washed before but the stain hadn't been removed. She also agreed that this shouldn't have happened and took the pillow case and said she'd meet us at the front desk. I took a picture of it just in case. We then went to check out thinking she'd at least provide some sort of discount from our room. Instead she gave us her card and said the next time we come to stay to ask for her and she'd give us a room upgrade. I really felt that we should have been discounted right then and there as supposed to us having to return. To be honest I don't believe we will ever return as this is not something we'd expect from a hotel of this standard and price. Maybe we should have just taken the pillow case down and made a deal about it at the front desk. This is something we'd expect from a $90/night hotel, not the Hotel Le Germain where you're paying $300-$400/night. Very very disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: IAKOVOS I
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for a romantic gettaway with my girlfriend, and it was FANTASTIC. The room, the views, the service, the proximity to all downtown attractions, everything! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Just WOW!! triple A”
Reviews.Author: placos
Reviews.Content: Amazing Room Amazing Service Amazing Location , the room are spectacular , the view might be average , but the way the rooms are designed is simply amazing , the service was great , amazing staff , concierge is just great vey helpfull , even gave us tickets for the ballet , location right next to the union station and the air canada center , a taxi ride from all the major restaurant and clothing store. the free expresso /tea bar on the second floor was great , the gym is very well set up . will go back to go see the maple leaf ! next time i am in town

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic escape”
Reviews.Author: Tuquesouq
Reviews.Content: We booked a weekend romantic package for a double room (off-season in winter), and received an upgrade to a suite with an enormous bathroom, jacuzzi tub, huge HD television, champagne & chocolate-covered strawberries greeting our arrival, and diligent room service. Couldn't ask for more on a frigid January weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Le Germain = Le Parfait”
Reviews.Author: edmbaby
Reviews.Content: One word: Perfect. For our 5th Wedding Anniversary, I surprised my husband with an overnight stay at the Le Germain Hotel Maple Leaf Square (he surprised me last week with a rockstar weekend). Our entire experience was top notch end-to-end. The 8th floor room we were upgraded to (thanks to Tripadvisor VIP Voucher) is reminiscent of high-end hotels in Tokyo, but bigger. Uber clean, modern design, high-tech everything (including the gym equipment which we used the morning of checkout), massive closet, bathroom to die for, and the beds... oh the beds and linens... I want them for my house and may just order it from the Le Germain online boutique store. The night we stayed was the night of the Pacquiao vs Marquez boxing fight on HBO PPV. My husband and I were excited to watch this of course... long story short, the concierge on duty that night (Gregory) was able to reserve a table for us in a neighbourhood sports bar and we were smack in front of a projection screen TV. This is an ultra luxurious experience and we felt we had the hotel all to ourselves. Ambient lighting and discreet service adds to the exclusivity feel. This hotel is the benchmark by which I will hold all other hotels to.

Reviews.Title: “Style Class and Location!”
Reviews.Author: joeyb1107
Reviews.Content: Although this is the 1st time we traveled to Toronto I must say that the Le Germain brand is one of a kind. The location is situated between the Maple Square arena, Toronto Skydome and CN Tower. The decor is modern and fresh and sleek. Room service may have even been our best meal! A cool part was a chauffeured Audi that takes you around town .Our balcony was no more than 50 feet away from a gigantic screen infront of the Maple Leafs Stadium.Real Sports Bar and Grill ( with a 32 ft screen) is connected from the rear of the building as is a wonderful supermarket and Starbucks. We were so comfortable with the location.Everything is minutes away.Toronto a a beautiful city and Le Germain is quite a value when you factor the no shortcut approach to excellence. ]

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleger
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, very well located in central Toronto. We had an executive suite which felt like no one had ever stayed in it before. What made the biggest difference though was the staff: extremely helpful and attentive. A special thank you to the two concierges Greg and Susanne (?) who made our stay unforgettable. This hotel is a "must stay"!

Reviews.Title: “Super modern hotel, well located and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: philippe_grimard
Reviews.Content: I consider myself picky, I like hotel with modern design and great service. This hotel totally filled my needs. Ask for a room on the last floor (8th) with a west view for a superb view on the CN tower and the turnpike.

Reviews.Title: “Love it love it love it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TheBigEasy3
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two daughters, aged 9 and 12, at the end of July for two nights. We booked here mainly for the location and were a little bit concerned at first if this hotel, being so modern, would be family friendly. We needn't have worried in the slightest as it turned out to be THE most family friendly hotel we have ever stayed in and then some! The staff were just brilliant, helping us out the second we got there, with parking, with our bags, with making the most of the stay, with directions - everything. They even sorted our daughters out with bathrobes!! Gregory, the concierge, was something else - if he worked in McDonalds he would be COVERED in gold stars! He would stop for a chat, he was a laugh, very knowledgeable - every hotel needs a Gregory! The rooms were just splendid, spacious, so very comfortable, modern, couldn't fault them. The location was spot on for us as we wanted to visit the CN Tower and had tickets for a baseball game at the Rogers Centre, both a few minutes walk away. The Waterfront was only a few minutes walk too, this made for some lovely family walks in the morning and there were some great places to eat. For us, everything just seemed to be on our doorstep. When we drove to Niagara Falls, the main road was easily accessible, no problems. All in all, I can't tell you how pleased we were that we decided to stay here, we had a fantastic time and this (very family friendly!) hotel and its staff were a big part of that.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel service and amazing decor”
Reviews.Author: lunalarrie
Reviews.Content: i travel extensively for business and leisure and this hotel was one of the best hotel experiences i've ever had. i LOVE LOVE LOVE the decor - canadian HOT athletes as art, industrial/chic design throughout. loved everything about the room too - hip jazz playing when i arrived to my room, bose speakers for my ipod, a real blackout curtain, and all the lights are on dimmer switches. SUSAN McNAUGHT the concierge is the BEST. ask her for some suggestions around town and you'll see what i mean. as far as the rest of the hotel - service was pretty top notch. i left my workout headphones at home and only had large Bose headphones, so someone went and got me some and hand delivered them while i was on the treadmill! they were just really accommodating throughout, something you rarely see done well at the big fancy chains.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shantilover
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff is phenomenal!! I have stayed here 3 times and love the everything about it. The decor is very modern and the rooms are gorgeous. I find a reason to come to Toronto just to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: KLRED
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square is top knotch! It is very modern and they staff is phenomenal! They are very polite and want to make sure you enjoy your experience. The rooms was great and the design was beautiful. We went to a maple leafs game while staying here and it was great that the venue was just steps away. It was also great that there was a grocery store attached and a bar and restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “St Germain always good”
Reviews.Author: Vvn
Reviews.Content: They are modern a bit funky, but in very good taste with the best appointments. This is the second time I have stayed with the organization and they are always good. Suite modern and interesting , but using the best of furnishings, Breakfast easy , nourishing and healthy. Staff very attentive. Good restaurant attached to it

Reviews.Title: “perfect balance of location, comfort, style and service - absolutely recommended”
Reviews.Author: firlefanz
Reviews.Content: here is one new hotel that seems to have gotten the balance perfectly right! location, service, rooms, facilities and overall fantastic location for downtown toronto - in easy walking distance to the waterfront, financial district, china town, convention centre and - not to forget - air canada center. also across from union station and easy access to public transportation and bicycle-rentals. overall service perfect, never in your face and never pretentious! lobby and bar (watch the fans push past to see toronto maple leafs play!) beautiful, chic and stylish, without trying too hard! reception and concierge staff incredibly friendly and helpful without ever being pushy! rooms absolutely beautiful and comfortable - clean lines, modern interior, very spacious and bright with lots of daylight! hotel was dotted with neat little touches, such as the fresh green apples - ripe for the picking - strategically placed and displayed at the elevator doors. cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. this is the one to stay at in downtown toronto - no contest!

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review - High End Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: happyinthewater
Reviews.Content: I am a very fussy travel agent and I loved this hotel. The service was wonderful, Mara at the front desk was very accomodating. The concierge, hotel car driver, and housekeeping staff were also wonderful. Hotel is newer, and you can tell. Very unique modern rooms, with all the amenities you expect at a top hotel. Looks exactly like the pictures shown on site. We absolutely loved the location, directly across the street from union station, and within walking distance to the boardwalk, CN Tower, and unique neighborhoods. There is a huge sports bar right next to the hotel, and you are also right by the sports stadiums. They have a bar/loung in the lobby, but we never took advantage of it. We traveled with friends, and we were both there celebrating our wedding anniversaries. My friends are extremely high maintenance, and they also loved this hotel. Free Wi-Fi in rooms, parking runs around $40 per night for valet, excellent coffee bar. Loved the fresh apples offered thoughout the hotel. The views from the rooms were nothing special, but the room itself was very nice. We did not have room service, so unable to rate that. They have a house car that will take you around the city if it is available. Also, the rooms do have irons and boards, they are hidden in a wooden wall panel. I will make this my first choice on my return travels to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrphysics24
Reviews.Content: Absolutely enjoyed my stay at Le Germain. Great location and very helpful staff. Walkable distance from the Union subway station and to many fine dining locations. The lounge was very nice, very comfy and spacious. Rooms are very nice and beds comfortable beyond expectations. Would have taken a two beds room in suite configuration if one was available. No problem spending time in bed, but would have appreciated a table with chairs... Really the only frustration came from the shower soap dispensers, giving just a tiny bit of soap every time!

Reviews.Title: “Sky high expectations exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: florist1995
Reviews.Content: What a great thanksgiving weekend in Toronto. Rare to do the research and pick what you think will be the best hotel and yet still be wowed and impressed when you arrive. Rooms are spacious. Beds are beyond comfy. Loved the espresso in the lounge. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. Sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: Canthinkofaname
Reviews.Content: Main plus points: - spacious room with iron and ironing board, hair dryer, minibar, free wifi, TV and radio - chic and contemporary - great bar - really really comfortable bed - helpful, friendly staff - convenient for transportation to all parts of Toronto, central enough to walk to many parts of the city Minus points - disappointing and expensive breakfast (no cooked breakfast available) - charge for coffee in room (and no complementary water) - mini bar wasn't topped up daily so I had to call down for milk/coffee - plug on the iron didn't fit properly into the socket - which meant it kept falling out of socket while in use

Reviews.Title: “Go there!”
Reviews.Author: SFKSAW
Reviews.Content: Just opened and spotless this is another fabulous little gem in the family. Ask for a room with a view of the CN Tower. There is construction of a new condo in front on that side - eventually the view will likely be eliminated. I've been able to stay in two other properties they own and the standard is the same. Unfailingly polite service and chic accomodations with well located properties. This one is next to where the Leafs play (and will continue their mediocre traditions). Not so the hotel. There is nothing mediocre. This may have been the nicest bed I've ever slept in - and I get to see a lot of hotels. Also, right next door is a gigantic sports bar. So if you have to be in Toronto, a place we Montrealers like to hate, then make sure you stay in a little piece of heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: biztravlr345
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at this hotel while in Toronto on business. I loved the rooms for their modern decor, functionality, space and overall comfort. Hotel staff were very helpful at all times. The Audi A8 that is available for short trips to the downtown core is a nice touch. I had a room that faced away from the street and therefore was very quiet. I will definitely return to this hotel and highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and view”
Reviews.Author: VancouverSrfrgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. Pluses: room decor, spaciousness and view of the CN Tower were great. It looks like another tower is being built across the street though so I wonder if the view of the CN Tower in some of the rooms will be affected by this in the future. Appreciated the controls by the bed. Staff were all friendly and helpful. The breakfast area/lounge on the second floor was nice. Breakfast items included breads, pastries, cheeses, cold cuts, lox, bread pudding, yogurt, juices and a nice coffee machine that makes espressos, caps, lattes, etc. It's about $20pp though which I feel is a little pricey for a basic spread like this. It's really more for the convenience that one would have breakfast in the hotel since there isn't much in the immediate vicinity and you'd have to walk up a few blocks before you reach other cafes and restaurants. It's a short walk to the St. Lawrence Market and the PATH is connected through Union Stn/Air Canada Center, which is convenient if the weather isn't nice enough to walk in. Union Station is convenient for striking out on the subway. One can take a shuttle from the airport to the Fairmont Royal York and then walk down a couple blocks to the hotel. The driver told me that I should have let him know I was staying at this hotel as he could have dropped me off so that I didn't have to walk down (the bus passes right by the hotel). My husband brought a car with him when he joined me for a couple days and valet was easy though a bit pricey. I suppose it's representative of most hotels in the city though. The rainshower was nice but I think the fixture needs to be decalcified as a number of the openings didn't have water coming through. The pressure was a little on the light side which could have been a result of the clogged openings or water pressure or both. The room had a Nespresso machine in it but they charge $2/capsule. I thought that was a little disappointing considering the room rates and the fact that each capsule is less than $1. Also, note that there's no iron and ironing board in the room. I'm assuming they'd make one available if you asked or you may need to send your item out for ironing. Overall though, very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect For The Price”
Reviews.Author: cbm3NYC
Reviews.Content: This is one of two Hotel Le Germain facilities in Toronto. The original is on Mercer Street and is a better experience than its new sibling at Maple Leaf Square. The designs are basically the same: contemporary finishes, fairly streamlined, overall clean and appealing, if not a little bit dated. I stayed in the smallest/lowest level room, which was a good size and featured very good light through a giant picture window. The view was of a construction site and highway, which was not so great, but that will get better over time as other projects in this emerging area are completed. Many of the rooms feature stall showers, as mine did, which I find very appealing. What is not appealing and leaves one to scratch his or her head is the incomprehensible lack of proper closet space. My room had two hanging closets, which were part of a "system", but had only two drawers and no shelves. The two drawers are located at floor level, so you have to bend down and touch your toes in order to access them. The space above the drawers was empty and useless, no hanging, no shelves, no hooks, just empty. In addition, the in room safe is located in an equally inconvenient floor level location so it's impossible to use without being on your hand and knees. The lighting and HVAC systems are an absurd, failed attempt at cutting edge efficient. The only way to turn on the lights is to insert your key in a slot by the door. This means of course that you have to leave your key there instead of in your wallet or bag, so the chances of forgetting it when you leave are high. Also, the privacy/service buttons, while sleek in replacing a door hanger, are located at the bed, not by the door, so as you're leaving, you have no way to see how it was left, and if you want to change it on your way out, you have to go back to the bed. The service is willing and friendly, but not quite up to par for the price of the hotel. I spent about $440 per night for the cheapest room before taxes or gratuities. I did not get turn down service any of the nights I was there (I asked once the first night) and the housekeeping in the room was a little haphazard (the clothing that I was forced to leave on the desk for lack of adequate closet space was always re-arranged after a housekeeping visit; some fruit that was delivered as a welcome gift - a nice touch - was left to decay for a few days before being removed, etc.). The common spaces (bar, breakfast area, etc) are adequate, but not luxurious or welcoming. Finally, the location is a disaster, at least in its current state. One of Toronto's nicest features is the walking accessibility of most downtown areas. While one can walk to most places from this location (and I did), it requires going under a dark, filthy underpass on a narrow sidewalk to get to southernmost portion of the downtown area. In addition, the surrounding area is one giant construction site, so there's no break from the noise, dirt and unappealing view. This will obviously improve with time, but it makes for a very unpleasant surrounding at present. I've stayed many times at the other Hotel Le Germain on Mercer Street, and I would recommend that one over this location despite the fact that this one is newer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on every level”
Reviews.Author: Brendan M
Reviews.Content: In town for the Toronto Film Festival, I ended up leaving another hotel (Hyatt Regency -- a dump) and switching to this hotel mid-stay. The staff here is excellent and go out of their way EVERY time you need something. The rooms are very nice (even though mine faced the back of hotel and an office building -- didn't matter) and bathrooms are nicer. Great beds, very comfortable. Great room service. Great bathroom products. Hotel has a house car (an Audi A8) that is available throughout the day to take you where you need to go. Hotel is slightly out of the way, but again, it's so nice it didn't matter. And you can just hitch a ride in the car anyhow. Price is great for what you're getting, honestly. I've stayed in many Four Seasons, many Ritz Carltons and without a doubt the service here is better. I would stay at this hotel again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Xalec
Reviews.Content: Great design, wonderful service & great location - my new favorite hotel in Toronto. Rooms are a generous size with an interesting layout and really well equipped. The free wifi is a great touch and a lovely change to all other hotels who still seem to think it's ok to charge a high room rate plus a fee for wifi. My only "could do better" is the bar shuts at midnight which on a Friday seemed a little early but the bar staff were so great they managed to get a drink and were very apologetic. All in all a great experience and makes me look forward to my next Toronto trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic bad luck - a memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: Magnus L
Reviews.Content: We're not best friends with Murphy. He has played with us a lot over the years. On the way to a wonderful weekend in New York, he obviously had to send hurricane Irene on us! So we ended up in Toronto instead. But what a wonderful "accident" that turned out to be. We had no idea what awaited us. But already at check in we realised this would be a great weekend after all. We received a fantastic welcome, a lovely room with a wonderful round bed and a large bathroom with a nice view of Toronto's skyline. But what impressed us the most was the genuinely service interested staff who gave everything and more to ensure our "miserable weekend" would be memorable after all - it was! So many thanks to you all, especially Evan and colleagues at the reception for your friendliness and sympathy and to Gregory the concierge for all tips from "hidden getaways" to great restaurants. We had no plans to go to Toronto, but we are already looking forward to our next time

Reviews.Title: “So romantic, so much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Suslew
Reviews.Content: After only two nights, my husband and I are in love with Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf and can't wait to stay again! We finished our honeymoon at Le Germain this weekend (August 19-21st) and had planned on lots of sight-seeing activities. The concierge service, in particular Susan and Gregory, was phenomenal! They spent as much time with us as needed to help plan our sight-seeing and dinner trips. They listened to what we wanted to do and came up with great day trip itineries. Our room was beautifully appointed - very modern with a most amazing view of the city. We could see the CN tower lights at night! And the bathroom! The soaking tub was slightly oversized (I took advantage after a hard day of sightseeing) and the shower had a very cool rainforest showerhead - very relaxing! There was a nice-sized flat panel tv, wireless internet access, and in-room safe. Switches to turn all room lights were conveniently located next to the bed. And, I should mention, for extra security, you need to use your room key to operate the elevators. Unless you're a guest of the hotel, you cannot access the room floors. The advertised continental breakfast was yummy! Le Germain offered the usual danish and bread assortments and then bumped it up a notch with meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, and oatmeal. And the coffee! Available 24/7 is a coffee machine that I want to own - it made the best latte I've had in a long time! You could also choose espresso, etc, but oh, the latte!! And my husband loved the huge selection of teas. Getting around the city was very doable also thanks to the hotel. Located directly next to Union Station, public transportation was never a problem. The hotel doormen were always happy to help with cabs. And, if more convenient, the hotel also provides a car service which was available to drop us off and pick us up when we asked. For tourists, please know that the CN tower, Roger Center, Union Station, Steam Whistler Brewery, Longo's (a super-supermarket) and, of course, the Air Canada Center are all within walking distance. If you need help planning your activities, be sure to take advantage of the wonderful concierge service provided by Susan and Gregory! Not much left to say except that we love this hotel, the people who work there, the comfort it offers, and all the amenities. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel to tourists - and I would think, to business people, too, although i can't speak personallly about the business-point-of-view. Great hotel. Great, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Seanybeats
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel it was so nice and modern I wish they had them in the states but it was overall the best hotel I've been to service top notch friendly to

Reviews.Title: “New favourite in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: hotinfo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a special weekend with my wife...first time at a Le Germain. Definitely will add this group to my choice hotels. Everything was well done from valet taking car upon check in, registration desk explaining hotel amenities, breakfast club room, to check out..all professionally done...with no attitude. That's a biggie for me...don't mind spending the money, but can't stand hotels, restaurants that think an attitude should be part of the ambiance. All Le Germain employees we came across were friendly and professional, very competent. Four Seasons chain does this as well, this group is right there with them. Only thing I wish they had was a guest loyalty program...

Reviews.Title: “Modern, stylish, amazing”
Reviews.Author: Gage L
Reviews.Content: What a treat it was staying here. I'm from Streetsville and live in London - I'm not far at all - but staying at this hotel made me feel like I was someone important, maybe a celebrity, in New York City or something. Every person I encountered during my stay was genuine, well trained and friendly. Nothing about the service I received here was a disappointment. I have and will continue to reccommend le Germain to anyone I know looking for a great getaway in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “IndyCar Toronto Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Markwy
Reviews.Content: Super everything! I was there for the IndyCar race weekend for 5 nights. I had a room with a great view of the CN Tower and it was fantastic from the room outlay, shower, bed, flat screen HDTV to name only a few things. It was a 2 minute walk to and through Air Canada Center to the Go train with a 6 minute train ride to the track. The only faster way would be by being beamed by transporter as on Star Trek. The staff are super and the hotel is beautiful and spotless. The resturant was great, cool huge sports bar and super cool grocery store all in the same building. Also a 5 minute walk to the CN Tower and Rodgers Center. I highly recommend this to all but remember you are downtown and it can be noisey. I hope to be back next year for the race and you know where I will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “I really doubt that I will ever even think of staying in a different hotel while in Toronto...”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Hy
Reviews.Content: Simply put, the hotel is exactly as advertised. Excellent staff, spotless, stylish, and convenient. It takes one variable (quality of my hotel) out of the equation when planning my next trip to Toronto. I would recommend Le Germain to anyone i care about.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: REV028
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently traveled to Toronto for a family wedding and choose the Hotel Le Germain primarily for its location. We were pleasantly surprised upon entering the hotel and our room. In my travels I have always said every hotel room in the world is virtually the same until we walked into our room at the Hotel Le Garmain. Exquisitely designed and furnished it invited you to stay in the room all weekend. The comfort of the bed is remarkable. To add to this, the service provided by the staff was excellent, from the doorman, to the receptionist to the concierge. If you find yourself travelling to Toronto you would not be disappointed staying at the Hotel Le Germain as it is conveniently located, modern and offers first class service.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: oz2095
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend getaway. We were to be staying at the sister property on Mercer St but they had a broken watermain and no water. They took very good care of us and directed us to this hotel. As soon as we arrived they got us a room. The service was great and the room was fantastic. Very bright and clean with every amenity you could want. It was luxurious but not stuffy-well suited to our tastes. We will be back and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip & Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: curiousgeorge514
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth visit to Le Germain. This is an exceptional hotel. It is very modern and very trendy as well. The location is superb. It is steps from Air Canada Centre, as well as a few minute walk from the Entertainment district. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable, and has remembered me each time, thus the personal touches make all of the difference. Second floor lounge has terrific breakfast and the hotel bar is a great place to hang out with friends and unwind. I will be back real soon...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel experience - top notch service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: SpaJunky
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 7 nights for business and during the Indy races and loved every moment of it. We stayed in a one-bedroom suite with dining table, living room, 1.5 baths and king bed. From the moment we walked in, we felt like we were at home and looked forward to coming back to the hotel each day. Everybody we encountered - from the doormen, front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The rooms are very sleek and modern with fantastic attention to detail. Beds were very comfortable with crisp white sheets and fluffy duvet and the ipod sound dock was a nice touch. The rain shower and deep soaking tub just topped it off. The location is very close to Union Station, right next door to the Air Canada Center and a block from the Queen's Quay harbour front. We would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: bajanjamie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night and it was a fabulous experience! We arrived in our 600 sq ft suite to find a huge bathroom (with rain shower head!), a funky round bed and a great sectional sofa which came in handy as we had 7 girls getting ready! Hotel Le Germain spoiled us with a cheesecake / chocolate / fruit platter and hand-written note, as well as a thoughtful wedding gift and complimentary late check out. Our rate included breakfast the next morning which was a really nice touch. Altogether a wonderful experience, we'll be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect room in the perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: srobinsonj
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square is something that I would recommend anyone who happens to read this does as one of life's necessities. You want to talk about a little slice of heaven. We were fortunate enough to enjoy our stay in room 832 which is one of the 2 rooms the hotel offers that have a humongous circle bed, the other being 732. The view from the room was nothing short of breathtaking. We even had windows that opened to let in some good ole fresh air. They thought of everything when they designed this place. The bathroom was out of this world with the nicest Invigorating rainfall spa I ever stepped in and a deep soaking bathtub that had a window that overlooked the rest of the room. Dual vanity sinks, bamboo cotton towels, branded 100% cotton bathrobes, everything was terrific. Our concierges Susan and Gregory were to put it plainly, fantastic. Everything I asked of them got done and then some. They even provided Audi chauffeured house car service to our various destinations to and from. Hands down the perfect hotel and the best one I have ever stayed in my lifetime. A must stay if you visit Toronto. Pure excellence!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!”
Reviews.Author: tyrelb
Reviews.Content: stayed in 732 and had a fantastic view of the CN tower. a must stay for anyone visiting Toronto - for business or pleasure. unbelievable service, clean rooms, and good value. restaurant in lobby is great, breakfast on the second floor is awesome... what else can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable experience”
Reviews.Author: Whiseboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Germain and what an experience it was. The hotel's location is perfect, right in the middle of Rogers center, CN tower and 10 steps away from the ACC. The hotel is very modern and the staff is incredible, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and to accomodate you. The room we stayed in was beautiful, very modern, luxurious and extremely comfortable. The rooms aren't your avegare size, they are quite large and the bathroom are second to none. The ony downside is that the parking is quite expensive, I was told to park at the hotel it would be $35 a day. You can park just a block south for $15 a day (York and Queen's Quay). I have no complaints, I would defenitely stay here again and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “hip, friendly staff, beauty!”
Reviews.Author: Hanshja
Reviews.Content: What can i say, everything was very, very good. The staff was very friendly, loved the breakfast area with a special relax lounge where you could sit all day and there was complimentary coffee. If there is one point of critisism, that would be the nespresso where you had to pay for in the room. Not what you'd expect in such a place.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again if I return to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Aus_abroad_11
Reviews.Content: For me this is the perfect place to stay if you're a business traveller. Rooms are new and clean, bathrooms have good quality amenities and the staff are very helpful but don't bother you too much. The bed and pillows are very comfortable and the room has its own nespresso coffee machine. Location is good for convention centre access and air Canada stadium. Very nice bar and restaurant on the corner 'eleven' as well as a super market around the corner, union station is just across the road and there is usually a taxi around if you prefer. The only criticism I would have is that if there is a concert on at air Canada the area surrounding the hotel gets very busy and you can also hear the noise of the concert but it wasn't late in the evening so it was not a real concern.

Reviews.Title: “A nice new hotel near all the sports stadiums and close to the financial centre”
Reviews.Author: Flyfisher1
Reviews.Content: This is a good base for Toronto and great if you want to take in a baseball, basketball or hockey game as next to stadiums. Short walk to the financial centre. Rooms are well appointed but we had one or two teething problems. The management did everything to put it right and we ended up changing rooms. Very helpful staff and excellent breakfast. Gym was ok but nothing special. Bedrooms have all the latest kit and are generally comfortable. However Maple Leaf Square is noisy on match nights so they provide earplugs! Good value and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: djlyle
Reviews.Content: My husband won a trip to Toronto to see a NHL Game (saw the Leafs vs Sabres, great game!) which included airfare and two nights accommodations for himself, me (his wife) and our two children, ages 6 and 10. Hotel Le Germain, on Bremner Blvd, is where they booked us and we had a great experience. The whole trip was wonderful, but among our experiences at the NHL game, CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame and sight seeing, Hotel Le Germaine is talked about just as much when we relay our stories and experience to friends and family. It is a very contemporary Hotel, and at first sight, not one you might imagine being a 'family' hotel but we soon were made to feel extremely welcome and comfortable by the VERY friendly, and hospitable staff. The lady Concierge who we met on Friday, (but was not there for the weekend) was SO nice and very personable, we wanted to thank her before we left but never had the chance. The weekend concierge seemed just as friendly and inviting. The Doormen were friendly and charming, the front desk employees were great as well. Everyone was so professional and all were doing their jobs well. We were very impressed! The rooms were just as impressive, very spacious and, like the rest of the hotel, very contemporary. LOVED the shower, and the whole bathroom actually. The beds were very comfortable. Loved the filtered water available in the hallways, decorative light strips throughout the hotel would change color daily depending on which sports team was playing that day, (blue for the leafs, red for the Raptors.) GREAT location, we barely ever had to go outside, (which was good, it was rainy and cold!). Could not have afforded the Luxury Room we stayed in on our own, not sure how much per night the other rooms are, but would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every single way”
Reviews.Author: keyki
Reviews.Content: I couldn't have asked for a better hotel. My husband was in town for a conference so my 10 month old daughter and I decided to tag along for the three days. The hotel and staff were extremely accomodatng to our baby. Our room was well equipped with a crib, baby bath, monitor, even a diaper genie! The room was a great size, staff was amazing, location was perfect! Couldn't have asked for a better hotel to enjoy the city. I've always been a fan of Le Germain but never travelled with my baby. This stay just exceeded every expectation. I will not go to any other hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Le Germain Continues the Tradition - Another Classy Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Northerngirl1
Reviews.Content: For years, Hotel Le Germain on Mercer St. has been our hotel of choice when visiting Toronto. After discovering the hotel about 8 years ago, weâ€™ve always enjoyed the amenities, the facilities, the rooms, the location, and especially the staff and service. During a recent trip to Toronto for business, I decided to try the new Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square. Very impressed! The place is â€œbrand-spankingâ€� new â€“ you can smell it when you walk into the modern and very cool lobby. I think there are still a few minor adjustments and bugs to work out, but, based on my experience, nothing that would keep anyone from booking now. In fact, I was so impressed, weâ€™ve decided to book the Hotel again on our way through Toronto next week for a sun vacation. One of the great things is the location. I was a little skeptical at first, as the hotel seemed a little removed from the downtown core, being south of Front Street and north of the Gardiner. The hotel looked to be surrounded by the ever-growing â€œCondoâ€� sprawl along the lakeshore and a little isolated. It is not a problem. Since we always walk or use transit when we are in the city, Le Germain Maple Leaf Square is, in fact, in an awesome location. Located out the back-door from Union Station and across from the Air Canada Centre, accessing the city is a breeze. Simply walk across the street, enter the west side of the AC C and after a very short route through the indoor PATH hallways, you enter directly into the GO Concourse at Union. In a minute you have direct access to the TTC subway system. It was extremely convenient. Anyone thinking of taking in a hockey game at the ACC â€“ you couldnâ€™t pick a more convenient hotel. The atmosphere and design of the new hotel follows the Le Germain style. Warm wood finishes, slate tiling, bamboo textured wall paper, clean lines, geometric patterns, soft lighting, and clever and unique design elements are throughout the hotel. There is a very cool metallic rope sculpture hanging in the Lobby. As you enter the elevators a simple pulsating sliver of light illuminates the floor in different colors. The ambiance is nice. The downstairs bar is spacious and a great place to unwind and have a drink. In the second floor breakfast room, LG Maple Leaf Square follows the tradition of providing an excellent high-end continental breakfast (included in the room price). Morning breakfast is one of the reasons we very much enjoy Le Germain. The automatic espresso/coffee machine, available to guests, is always well-used when we visit. Management seems to have incorporated all of the best features we appreciate in the design of their new rooms at their other Toronto hotel. I booked a Superior Room with a king bed. The room is a bit larger than the standard rooms on Mercer street. The windows run the full length of the room so there is plenty of sunlight â€“ I had a great view of the CN Tower and the Toronto skyline. A well designed desk area, and built-ins, run the full length of the room under the windows. It was great for working over the course of the two days. There is a recessed pod with accessible power outlets, and data and AV links. There are full privacy shades that fully cover the windows. Exterior noise was minimal. Opposite the bed is a wall component with a large built-in flat screen TV. To the side is shelving. (Note â€“ someone thought it would be a good idea to locate the one light switch for the main wall recessed lighting, inside the shelf, and hidden from view! It was a bit of a challenge to turn out the lights the first night when I was ready for bed. Although there is a convenient control centre beside the bed to turn out all the lights, this didnâ€™t solve the problem if you wanted to read. I was about ready to call down to the front desk to ask for directions to the light switch when I finally located it. Directing guests to this hidden light switch might be a good idea.) The beds, and bed linens are awesome â€“ soft full duvets, lots of pillows and perfect mattresses are first rate. We love the bedding at LG! And of course â€“ there is the bathroom. The dressing room, bath area and amazing rainforest shower stall are all very well laid out. The separate toilet is in a frosted glass enclosure, with whisper smooth rollers on steel tubing. The shaving mirror, glass basin, wooden vanity and large mirrored surfaces, stainless steel and tile (with bath robes ready for use) cover one area, and a dual glass-door closet and alcove for luggage, is accessible from the bedroom and the small hall. It is the central, glassed, walk-in shower stall, and the signature rainforest shower, that is so very impressive. The fixtures are ultra-modern and the overhead shower fixture is a huge squared steel plate that delivers a full-body rainforest-style shower (after a slight learning curve in figuring out the controls - you have to press the button on the right square tube and turn it to increase the temperature). If you require privacy there are full-slat wooden blinds to close off the glassed enclosure. There are full-bottle Molton Brown dispensers on the wall of the shower â€“ no tiny bottles to mess around with. The hotel is apparently not yet fully complete, but yet most of the services seemed available. There is a first-class fitness room with brand-new equipment, free weights, cardio machines, in a well-laid out area on the 4th floor. There is a computer terminal available on the second floor which I used for work â€“ it was seamless, with full printing and no waiting. I popped in my USB key and printed documents. A three hole punch was thoughtfully present for use. (Strangely, when I returned the next day, the computer had been relocated into the cupboard, and the USB access was gone. The front desk assisted in printing documents.) Le Germain is environmentally conscious â€“ there are large stoneware urns dispensing filtered water in multiple locations, with glass carafes in your room to refill as you wish. I very much like this feature. Although the web site seemed to be unclear as to the presence of a restaurant in the hotel, the new restaurant, â€œe11evenâ€� is adjacent to the hotel and accessible through the lobby. Didnâ€™t have a chance to try it out, but looks very nice â€“ extensive menu and the number of wines by the glass is impressive. There were a few minor glitches. There were none of the usual written materials in my room on the first two nights providing any info on services, dining, hours, room service etc. I had to extend my stay to a third night, and was in a different room, and there was at least the room-service menu on the desk. I assume the usual package of info will be forthcoming. They forgot to leave a bath mat on the second night â€“ not a big deal. The biggest issue was my malfunctioning phone when I switched rooms on the third night. The phones are cordless. As I was going to bed, I tried using the phone to call down for a wake-up call and discovered it was not functioning. After pressing the connect button â€“ the phone began an intermittent dial tone but then cut out and began to ring non-stop. Attempting to connect was futile as the dial-tone would kick out and the phone would again begin to ring. Hmmmm - not good. As it was midnight I did not feel like waiting for maintenance. The only option to stop the phone from ringing, was to unplug the phone, set my cell phone alarm and head to bed. However, at 5:05 a.m. the handset or phone then began beeping, waking me up a little earlier than I wanted to! I couldnâ€™t call down to confirm my transportation so I likely appeared a little cranky when I attended at the front desk. The fellow was very apologetic and helpful when I went down, and helped me grab a cappuccino. The phone issues may need to be looked at. I expect these are little things that usually have to be sorted out upon opening. I note from the prior review that another recent guest was not so lucky with his room! I agree that this is unacceptable. Definitely management needs to ensure that ALL rooms in their inventory that receive guests are fully ready for occupancy on their opening. Mine was (except for the phone on night 3) and from past experience, I am trusting that I wonâ€™t be let down when I return again next week. Generally, it is the staff at Le Germain that we very much appreciate. We have always found that all of the staff at LG are gracious, helpful, friendly and very professional. The new hotel staff at LGMLS continues the tradition and they are very welcoming and accommodating. Although the hotel is larger and will likely be busier, there is still a genuine personal level of friendly service in all respects. Upon returning to my room the first night, the concierge team had left a tray with fresh fruit, crackers, a cheese ball and a maple spread, with a hand-written note. A nice touch. Overall, Iâ€™d certainly recommend the new Hotel Le Germain Maple Leaf Square. This is on the strength of past experience and trust that the bugs will be ironed out. Le Germain appears to be continuing the tradition of classy, personalized, and high-end hotelier services, at fairly reasonable rates. I was very impressed with their latest addition. The only difficult thing now, will be deciding which Le Germain Hotel to return to when we visit Toronto. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite 'chain'”
Reviews.Author: grumpel7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in three different Hotel Le Germain hotels this year, and given my experience, I would stay at one in every town I visit if I had that choice. Then again, I enjoy the fact that this hotel 'chain' is not a massive coroporation that is focused on expanding beyond quality. My partner and I stayed at this latest hotel to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary and the staff (including the ones who took my reservation initially - we booked before the reservation system was available) were exceptionally friendly and nice. After a warm chat at the desk while checking in, we went up to our floor and opened our room and turned on the light with our wireless door card. We had an extraordinary view of the city and the CN Tower, and to our delight, found a sweet anniversary present in the form of a chocolate / goat cheese platter with a note by the concierge team - the treats were appreciated but what really impressed me was the handwritten long note (see pic). The rooms are signature Le Germain, with a location specific touch (wall hanging is inspired by sports), the wonderful rain shower in the middle of the room and a switch system that allows you to set the lights to "ambient" or indicate whether you want to not be disturbed or the room to be cleaned. I like that each room always has two robes and an umbrella for guests to use. This new hotel is located right next to the Air Canada Centre, a popular new sports bar & lounge and a huge supermarket - we were able to walk around without having to bring our jackets (a big plus in December!). After our dinner we decided to sit in the second floor lounge with a cappucino (friendly staff helped us with it) and people watch - it overlooks Bremner which usually teams with traffic and pedestrians after a game at the ACC. Breakfast was free and good as always but we never had a chance to use the free Internet. Thank you for taking such good care of us, again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: dprins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our two teenage sons. The rooms were quite spacious with fantastic views. The hotel is right next door to the Air Canada Centre and just down the street from the Rogers Centre and Convention Centre. There are loads of things to do and see all within walking distance. Staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. We often head to Toronto for weekends away and enjoy trying different hotels.... this hotel is definitely a favourite. We look forward to our next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdm127
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently at this newly opened hotel and it was fantastic. Great location - right beside Air Canada Centre, walking distance to financial district and near the waterfront. Rooms are modern yet comfortable. Flat screen TV, work desk (free internet), cool layout - including showers with 360 degree view of room. Free continental breakfast included and it looks like they were getting ready to open a lobby bar. This hotel is located in a bigger complex that includes condos and retail, yet has its own entrance. There is easy access to a very nice restaurant in the complex plus one of the best rated sports bars in North America (RS Bar & Grill) that has over 150 flat screen TVs and a 2 story high-def TV â€“ a sports fans ultimate dream. There is also a Longos grocery store located in the complex where you can pick up lots of pre-made food. The service was fantastic from the door staff to the front desk staff to the breakfast staff. I would definitely choose this hotel for its location, modern conveniences and value.
